post.desc:
Hmm... the way I understand 娘娘 now is that it **can** be for referring to any female figure with reverence and respect. Emphasis on "can" because the definition of this phrase is primarily reserved for really high-ranking women like empresses and goddesses. One that comes to mind would be a mother goddess.

So when understanding the translation from "Seiga Nyan Nyan" to "**Lady** Seiga", do note that this "Lady" is really close to the top on the importance hierarchy. She's basically styling herself as a goddess. Wicked.
